rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.'

rationale: 'short-term blip' is a metaphor but not listed as a potent metaphor in Q2.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.'

rationale: The phrase 'were a 'short-term blip'' is descriptive, not a moderate verb + scale.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.'

rationale: No loaded rhetorical question designed to imply alarm.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.'

rationale: Contains the Transient-Issue Minimiser cue 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly'.
